entry.title: The Steinbrenner lab at Plant Bio 21

link.title: The Steinbrenner lab at Plant Bio 21

entry.content:
The lab will be well represented at this year’s ASPB Plant Bio meeting. Our posters and talks are listed below!

Simon Snoeck CS-19-1 - The evolution and ancestral reconstruction of the pattern recognition receptor INR in the Phaseoleae Thursday, July 22, 2021 2:30pm – 2:45pm EDT

Natalia Guayazaán-Palacios Thursday, July 22, 2021 3:00pm – 3:02pm EDT CS-20-3 - Herbivore-specific plant defenses are gated by the circadian clock in Cowpea

Anthony Garcia Friday, July 23, 2021 3:00pm – 3:02pm EDT CS-24-3 - Developing Genetically Encoded Reporters for Plant Immune Recognition of Herbivory

Ava Kloss-Schmidt (poster) Studying Herbivory Defenses in the Absence of a Functional Immune Receptor Through the Development of a Near Isogenic Line of Phaseolus vulgaris

Adam Steinbrenner (poster) Immune Recognition of Chewing Herbivores
entry.summary: The lab will be well represented at this year’s ASPB Plant Bio meeting. Our posters and talks are listed below!

entry.title: Anthony Garcia joins as a Research Technician

link.title: Anthony Garcia joins as a Research Technician

entry.content: Anthony recently graduated from UW and will stay on as a Research Technician in the lab. Congrats Anthony!
entry.summary: Anthony recently graduated from UW and will stay on as a Research Technician in the lab. Congrats Anthony!

entry.title: Happy 2021
entry.content: Happy new year from the lab!
entry.summary: Happy new year from the lab!

entry.title: Receptor work is out in PNAS

link.title: Receptor work is out in PNAS

entry.content:
Our receptor story, previously in bioRxiv, is finally published in PNAS!
“A receptor-like protein mediates plant immune responses to herbivore-associated molecular patterns”
entry.summary: Our receptor story, previously in bioRxiv, is finally published in PNAS! “A receptor-like protein mediates plant immune responses to herbivore-associated molecular patterns”

entry.title: Natalia Joins the Lab
entry.content: Natalia Guayazán-Palacios, rising 2nd year Biology grad, has joined the lab. Welcome Natalia!
entry.summary: Natalia Guayazán-Palacios, rising 2nd year Biology grad, has joined the lab. Welcome Natalia!

entry.title: New Review in Current Opin. Plant Biol.

link.title: New Review in Current Opin. Plant Biol.

entry.content: Adam’s new review on the evolution of cell surface immune networks is online at Current Opinion in Plant Biology and can be found here. We would love to discuss!
entry.summary: Adam’s new review on the evolution of cell surface immune networks is online at Current Opinion in Plant Biology and can be found here. We would love to discuss!

entry.title: Fall conference: APACE
entry.content: Prof. Steinbrenner will attend the 10th Conference of the Asia-Pacific Association of Chemical Ecologists in Hangzhou, China. He will present in Session 3: “Signaling and Perception in Plant-Herbivore Interactions.” Say hello if you are also attending, and come to hear about INR and our future plans to understand evolution of immune recognition across bean populations.
entry.summary: Prof. Steinbrenner will attend the 10th Conference of the Asia-Pacific Association of Chemical Ecologists in Hangzhou, China. He will present in Session 3: “Signaling and Perception in Plant-Herbivore Interactions.” Say hello if you are also attending, and come to hear about INR and our future plans to understand evolution of immune recognition across bean populations.

entry.title: Antonio Chaparro joins the lab
entry.content: The lab’s first official member has joined! Antonio will join as a technician. Heis a recent graduate of the UW and comes in with experience in plant molecular genetics from his undergraduate research. Welcome Antonio!
entry.summary: The lab’s first official member has joined! Antonio will join as a technician. Heis a recent graduate of the UW and comes in with experience in plant molecular genetics from his undergraduate research. Welcome Antonio!

entry.title: Summer conferences: MPMI, ASPB
entry.content: We will present our INR preprint and other transcriptomic and genomic follow-ups at MPMI in Glasgow and ASPB in San Jose Aug 3-7 https://aspb.org/event/plant-biology-2019/
entry.summary: We will present our INR preprint and other transcriptomic and genomic follow-ups at MPMI in Glasgow and ASPB in San Jose Aug 3-7 https://aspb.org/event/plant-biology-2019/

entry.title: Inceptin Receptor Preprint is Live
entry.content: The core of Adam’s postdoctoral work is now posted on bioRxiv (https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/679803v1) in a manuscript entitled “A Receptor for Herbivore-Associated Molecular Patterns Mediates Plant Immunity.” We are excited to connect surface immune recognition to chewing herbivory through INR. We’re very happy it’s available on bioRxiv as it works its way through journal submission. Comments are welcome, please email or Twitter DM @ADSteinbrenner.
entry.summary: The core of Adam’s postdoctoral work is now posted on bioRxiv (https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/679803v1) in a manuscript entitled “A Receptor for Herbivore-Associated Molecular Patterns Mediates Plant Immunity.” We are excited to connect surface immune recognition to chewing herbivory through INR. We’re very happy it’s available on bioRxiv as it works its way through journal submission. Comments are welcome, please email or Twitter DM @ADSteinbrenner.
